dataIdInfo.idPurp: This shapefile contains solar polygons within the Narragansett Bay Watershed as of the summer of 2022 with the land cover area for the solar panels of the installations before conversion to solar.
dataIdInfo.idAbs:
The solar field boundaries are derived from Sentinel-2A satellite imagery with a resolution of 10 meters.

This shapefile contains ground solar installations (no rooftop solar)

Sentinel-2A imagery from 06/01/2022-08/31/ median cloud-free values were clipped to the Narragansett Bay Estuary Program (NBEP) boundaries. A Random Forest Classification was run in GEE with solar training sites (17 elements) and non-solar training sites (18 elements). The RF algorithm was trained for 1000 iterations using Sentinel-2A bands 2 (blue), 8 (NIR), 11 (SWIR-1), and 12 (SWIR-2). 80% of the samples were used to train while the other 20% were used for validation. The trained model was applied to the Sentinel-2A imagery to produce a hard classification of solar vs non-solar. This RF classification was exported to QGIS. The Sentinel-2A imagery was imported into QGIS and mean shift smoothing was applied before segmenting the data. Zonal statistics were used to combine the RF pixel-based classification and the vector data segmented from the smoothed imagery. The average number of pixels identified as “solar” in each segment was calculated and segments below a 0.8 mean solar value were eliminated.

Polygon boundaries were then manually corrected using Sentinel-2A imagery and hand digitization within QGIS.

Zonal statistics were then performed using the polygons and the OB-COLD recent land cover disturbance map, and the mode value of the most recent year of disturbance was assigned to the polygon as the year of construction.

The data were then manually checked using NAIP and Landsat imagery to ensure accuracy, and erroneous year constructed values were corrected.

To derive land cover conversion area, the area of these polygons was calculated using Lambers Equal Area Conic (EPSG:9822 ) and zonal statistics were applied in GEE using the USGS LCMAP land cover dataset for 2010, the year before the earliest solar installation. Therefore, the area of land cover converted to solar for each polygon is what was present in that area as of 2010.

Field descriptions:

cleared_ar: area in square meters of cleared polygon, including both solar panels and cleared area outside solar panel cover.

solar_area: area in square meters of solar panel cover within cleared polygon

date_built: Unix time of the start of year constructed

year: year the solar field was constructed

forest: area in square meters of forest within solar polygon in 2010, as defined by LCMAP land cover classes.

wetland: area in square meters of wetland within solar polygon in 2010, as defined by LCMAP land cover classes.

barren: area in square meters of barren cover within solar polygon in 2010, as defined by LCMAP land cover classes.

developed: area in square meters of developed cover within cleared solar in 2010, as defined by LCMAP land cover classes.

water: area in square meters of water within solar polygon in 2010, as defined by LCMAP land cover classes.

grassland: area in square meters of grassland within solar polygon in 2010, as defined by LCMAP land cover classes.

unknown: area in square meters of unknown cover within solar polygon in 2010, as defined by LCMAP land cover classes.

agriculture: area in square meters of agriculture within solar polygon in 2010, as defined by LCMAP land cover classes.

snow: area in square meters of snow within cleared solar in 2010, as defined by LCMAP land cover classes.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.
